newsitem.title: FRANCE: Legionnaire shot dead in brawl in Corsica.
newsitem.headline: Legionnaire shot dead in brawl in Corsica.

text.p: A foreign legionnaire, possibly of British or American origin, was shot dead in a discotheque brawl on the turbulent French Mediterranean island of Corsica early on Saturday, police said.
Legionnaire Joseph Parker of the famed fighting unit's Second Parachute Regiment was hit by several bullets to the chest fired by an unidentified man with whom he had a violent argument, police said.
A policeman who tried to intervene was shot in the stomach and seriously wounded while the gunman escaped, police said.
No details were available about Parker in keeping with the French Foreign Legion's tradition of shielding the past of its personnel, most often at their own request.
About five percent of the Legion's 8,500 men are native English speakers. Most recent recruits come from East Europe.
